text: Take them aboard the Monarch and give them provisions.

head_text.subj: THE LAST CIVILIAN TO LEAVE THE CAGE IS A YOUNG, BEAUTIFUL

text: WOMAN IN HER 20’S -- OLIVIA COLE. SHE STARTS TO GO ABOVE
CAPTAIN TOMS (CONT’T - Tell us what happened, Miss?
My brother and I were sailing aboard the Grafton to Hudson Bay when the French ran us aground. We had secured work in the Americas --
And your brother?
HENRY MADDOX (CONT’D) You’re safe now, Miss. On this I promise.
Will you free the others as well?
Others?
Below.

head_text.subj: CAPTAIN TOMS WALKS DOWN INTO THE DARK BILGE AT THE BOTTOM

text: I could hear their screams at night, Sir. But then it stopped.

head_text.subj: IN THE DARKEST CORNER OF THE SHIP THERE ARE FOUR CAGES --

text: Dead animals?

head_text.subj: THE CAGES NOW ILLUMINATED BY LANTERNS
SEES A GLIMPSE OF WHAT IS INSIDE.

text: No, Sir. Witches. Four witches in cages. Their throats slashed. OLIVIA SCARED NOW ——
Why were they here?
The French are losing the war -- their people starved. These witches were tortured -- forced to search for treasure.
Then why were they killed?

head_text.subj: CAPTAIN TOMS WALKS TOWARD A HUGE IRON VAULT THAT HAS B

text: Perhaps they found what they were looking for.

head_text.subj: THE VAULT DOORS ARE BLOWN OPEN WITH GUNPOWDER. AS THE SMO
CLEARS WE SEE A SMALL WOODEN BOX INSIDE.
CAPTAIN TOMS TAKES THE ANCIENT BOX AND SLOWLY OPENS IT.
INSIDE THERE IS A LARGE YELLOW DIAMOND
DIAMOND IS STARING BACK AT HIM.

text: CAPTAIN TOMS (CONT’D) The Eye of Poseidon. Legend says it once held its place in the center of the Trident.
The Trident of Poseidon?

head_text.subj: CAPTAIN TOMS STARES AT THE EYE --

text: Imagine a Navy that could never be defeated. A nation that could never be conquered. To hold the Trident is to control more than the sea. It is to control the world.
The Trident exists -- hidden where no Man can see. ONE OF THE WITCHES IS ALIVE INSIDE HER CAGE. SHE’S HALF D
WITCH (CONT’D) Only The Eye can show you the way.

head_text.subj: THE WITCH MOVES FORWARD IN HER CAGE

text: A storm comes for you now. ‘Tis time, Captain. ‘Tis time to die.

head_text.subj: KILLED IN HER CAGE. AND CAPTAIN TOMS HOLSTERS HIS WEAPON
A HEAVY STORM LASHES THE MONARCH, WHICH SAILS FOR HOME
THROUGH ROUGH SEAS. CAPTAIN TOMS IS ON DECK WATH H

text: WAVES CRASHING OVER THE SIDES AS THEY FIGHT THE @m™-r* —
We've been blown off course, Sir! INT. — HULL OF MONARCH. — CONTINUOUS

head_text.subj: DOWN IN THE HULL ALL OF THE FREED PRISONERS ARE RIDING OU
THE STORM. HENRY MADDOX WALKS TOWARD OLIVIA, WHO SITS ALO

text: Miss -- you should eat something.
Thank you, Sir.
Sir? No, Miss, I’m no officer. My name is Henry Maddox -- Captain's servant for now.
Olivia Cole.

head_text.subj: THE SHIP IS ROCKED BY A HUGE WA 7

text: Henry, are you not afraid of the storm?
I’m not scared of anything, Miss. They call me “Lucky” Maddox, because not a single man has died since I’ve come aboard.
Maybe they’re the lucky ones.

head_text.subj: SHE REACHES OUT AND TAKES HIS HAND

text: OLIVIA (CONT’D) These scars are from a sickle. What kind of farm do you come from?
We had clover and turnips.

head_text.subj: AND NOW SHE SHOWS SHOW HIM HER OWN HANDS

text: Barley and wheat.
Do you miss the harvest?
I dream about it all the time.

Then we dream together. SHE LOOKS DOWN -- REALIZES SHE’S STILL HOLDING HIS HAND - HENRY MADDOX (CONT’D) You’re not alone, Olivia. I’11 protect you. If you like. SHE LETS GO OF HIS HAND NOW -- HIDES A SMILE.
You carry no weapon.
It's my first season on the Monarch. Next month I get my irons.
Then how could you ever defend me?
I told you. I’m Lucky.

head_text.subj: SUDDENLY THE SHIP GETS ROCKED BY A HUGE WAVE

text: It’s not the wind. It’s the current. She’s pulling us in!
Into what, Sir?
Into there.

head_text.subj: THROUGH THE STORM WE SEE TWO LARGE ROCK FORMATIONS STANDI
GUARD IN THE MIDDLE OF THE SEA. A THICK, HEAVY FOG STANDS
LIKE A DOOR BETWEEN THE TWO ROCKS --
WE SEE A MASSIVE BODY OF WATER LIT WITH A CRACKLING FLASH

text: THE DEVIL’S TRIANGLE!

head_text.subj: NOW ALL THE SOLDIERS ON DECK FURIOUSLY WORKING TOGETHER T
TRY AND KEEP THE MONARCH FROM SAILING INTO THE TRIANGLE -
BUT NO MATTER HOW HARD THEY TRY
THE FOG BETWEEN THE TWO ROCKS --
THE CREW WATCHING AS THE MONARCH SAILS IN. SUDDENLY
AS IF THEY HAD SAILED INTO THE GATES OF HELL --

text: Ship off the bow!
That’s no ship. It’s a shipwreck.

head_text.subj: THROUGH THE FOG AND STEAM A SHIPWRECK APPEARS

text: SHIPWRECK IS ABOVE WATER -- AND SOMEHOW IT’S NOT SINKING.

head_text.subj: AT FIRST IT SEEMS TO BE DRIFTING

text: SHIPWRECK IS SAILING WITHOUT SAILS --—
SHE’S COMING RIGHT AT US!!

head_text.subj: AND NOW THE SHIP SAILS STRAIGHT THROUGH THEM

text: Sir?
Prepare the cannons!

head_text.subj: CAPTAIN TOMS COMES DOWN THE STAIRS

text: What are you waiting for! Ready the guns! THE MEN DON’T MOVE. NOISES ARE HEARD -— CREAKING SOUNDS.

head_text.subj: HENRY MADDOX STANDS WITH OLIVIA IN THE SHADOWS

text: Olivia, wait here. Don’t move. DEAD SILENCE. ONE OF THE OLDER SOLDIERS STEPS BACK.
They say to enter these waters is to enter the gates of hell.
I’LL HAVE NO TALK OF THAT!

head_text.subj: THEM. THE LANTERNS GO OUT ON THEIR OWN

text: CAPTAIN TOMS (CONT’D) Take position.

head_text.subj: THE SOLDIERS PUSH THEMSELVES AGAINST THE WALLS

text: DRIPPING FROM THEIR FACES AS THEY HOLD THEIR WEAPONS -—

head_text.subj: LOOKING TO THE STAIRS AND WAITING --

text: THE SOLDIERS READY TO FIRE -—

FEAR. HE GRABS HER AND PULLS HER THROUGH THE SHIP -—

head_text.subj: DIRECTIONS NOW AS MEN ARE THROWN VIOLENTLY INTO THE SIDE
HENRY PULLING OLIVIA TOWARD THE BACK STAIRS.

text: What’s happening!!
Come with me! EXT. — MONARCH. - NIGHT

text: CAPTAIN BRAND (CONT’D) No need to be afraid, boy. HENRY GLANCES OUT A GUNNER’S WINDOW -- SEES OLIVIA FLOATI

WE CAN SEE HIS THROAT HAS BEEN CUT. HIS VOICE IS STRAINED

text: CAPTAIN BRAND (CONT’D) Today is your lucky day. I always keep one man alive.

text: CAPTAIN BRAND (CONT’D) One man to tell the tale.

text: Today we dedicate the Royal Bank of Saint Martin -- the most secure banking institution in the Caribbean.

WINDOW AT THE BACK OF THE BANK --

text: Our new vault is made from crucible steel. She is five inches thick -- stands as tall as any man and weighs an imperial ton. She will never be stolen or robbed --

IN THE CENTER OF THE ROOM. THEY TIE ROPES TO THE BOTTOM O

ROPES ARE FED THROUGH THE HOLE
GIBBS AND SCRUM EACH GRAB THE ROPES

text: The Governor has placed his personal gold reserves inside this new branch -- a bank protected by the Royal Guard!

head_text.subj: PIRATES ARE TYING ROPES TO FOUR CARRIAGES --

text: With the opening of this bank -- we enter the modern world!

head_text.subj: AS THE BANK DOORS OPEN AND A BAND STARTS TO PLAY --
CARRIAGES TO THE BACK OF THE BANK --
GIBBS AND SCRUM AT THE REINS OF THE LEAD WAGON --
INSIDE THE BANK WE SEE THE ROPES TIGHTEN AROUND THE VAULT

text: BUT THE VAULT DOESN’T MOVE --
SHE WON’T BUDGE!!

text: Excuse me. If I could have your attention for just one moment.

head_text.subj: THE CROWD REACTING AS JACK STEPS TO THE EDGE OF THE ROOF

text: JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) I was wondering if you wouldn’t mind helping me to rob this bank.

head_text.subj: TEN GUNS ARE IMMEDIATELY POINTED UP AT JACK

text: You are a mile from the sea, Pirate! Lower your weapon or you will be shot.
Being shot will do just fine.

ALL OF THE HORSES SPOOKED BY THE GUNFIRE

We're taking the vault.

Bridge. BRIDGE!!!

AS THE SMOKE CLEARS JACK SLOWLY REACHES IN
SINGLE GOLD COIN. HE TURNS TO SEE HIS CREW STARING AT HIM

text: I told you robbing a bank would be easy.

head_text.subj: JACK MAKES HIS WAY BACK TO THE WHEEL OF HIS SHIP

text: You promised each of us a bar of gold. It’s been months since we've seen any spoils, Captain.

head_text.subj: JACK QUICKLY POCKETS THE SINGLE GOLD COIN --

text: Am I to be blamed for the monetary failures of the men I steal from? Now line up so I may collect your daily tribute.
Tribute? We're starved, Captain. Yesterday we ate a rat.
It was a very big rat. Luckily the ship is overrun with them -- and I charge very little for each.
They are quite tasty.
I‘ll pay no tribute! We’ll never find treasure on a ship such as this.
I hear the pirate William Kidd is looking for hands -- has a ship with a hundred cannons.
Not to mention his balls -- 18 pounds each they say!
Well -- it’s not the size that matters.  14.
We’re down to three cannonballs. Face it, Captain, your luck has run aground.

head_text.subj: THE MEN SLOWLY MOVE TOWARD JACK WITH WEAPONS IN HAND

text: Let me remind you all that without me you'd all be poor, destitute, unwanted miscreants.
Jack, even with you we appear to be poor, destitute, unwanted miscreants.
Then I guess my secret must be shared.
Secret?

There’s a treasure in Port Royal that will change our fortunes forever. I can’t speak its name -- as it has yet to come to me -- but there will soon be jewels stuffed in every man’s pockets. And those of you without pockets can shove them somewhere else.
Jewels?
Diamonds! Or my name isn’t Captain Jack Sparrow. THE MEN CHEER NOW -- JUST AS A RAT SCURRIES BY ON DECK. JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) That one’s on me.

head_text.subj: THE MEN RUSH OFF AS JACK TURNS BACK TO THE WHEEL. GIBBS

text: Sir, I fear you’re about to lose command of this rotting ship. Perhaps it’s time to go ashore.
Ashore?  15.
Just for a year or two. It was a good run, Jack -- but it would seem your luck has turned. THIS IS HARD FOR GIBBS TO SAY.
It’s over, Captain.

head_text.subj: JACK HOLDS UP THE BLACK PEARL

text: Nothing is over, Mr. Gibbs. All I need is my ship to put things right.
You've spent years trying to free the Pearl from her bottle -- rubbed magic oils from Cape Raye and sorcerer's salt from Pimlico! You even danced naked in Dove’s Cove.
Dove's Cove had nothing to do with the Pearl. I just felt like dancing. JACK TURNS TO GIBBS NOW -—— JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) You say it’s over. I say it’s time to knock on a Red Door in Port Royal.
A Red Door? No, Jack -- that witch talks to the devil himself.
I have no choice, Gibbs. I can’t be Captain Jack Sparrow without my ship. And I can’t have my ship without a witch.

head_text.subj: A BRITISH ARMY WAGON ROLLS BY FULL OF WOMEN

text: “WITCHES” ROUNDED UP AND HEADING FOR THE JAILS. SOLDIERS FOOT TRAILING THE WAGON -——
Witches of Port Royal, by order of Admiral Scarfield turn yourselves in. No good will come from hiding -- you will be found by the British Navy.  16.

head_text.subj: THE WAGON PASSES BY CARINA SMYTH, (29, BEAUTIFUL)
EMERGES FROM BETWEEN TWO BUILDINGS. SHE IS HIDING IN THE

text: CARINA WEARS A PLAIN WHITE DRESS -- NO GLOVES OR HAT -—-

head_text.subj: QUICKLY MOVES THROUGH TOWN UNTIL SHE STOPS IN FRONT OF A

text: SHOP. THE SIGN READS: SWIFT’S CHART HOUSE.

head_text.subj: MAPS. CHARTS. SHIPS LOGS, ALL PILED FLOOR TO CEILING.

text: INT. — SWIFT’S CHART HOUSE. - DAY

head_text.subj: CARINA SLOWLY WALKS IN THE FRONT DOOR OF THE STORE
AROUND LIKE A KID IN A CANDY SHOP.

text: Did you not see the sign, Miss?
HE’S WORKING ON AND SLOWLY WALKS TOWARD HER.
Sir, I require a lens. One strong enough to capture Venus.
You. They're looking for you. You’re one of them!
No. Please -- I can pay you --
WITCH! THERE’S A WITCH IN MY STORE!!!

head_text.subj: AS SWIFT RUSHES TO THE BACK OF HIS STORE CARINA QUICKLY T
ABOUT TO LEAVE WHEN SHE SPOTS A LARGE TELESCOPE FACING OU
SHE LOOKS THROUGH THE LENS FOR A BEAT
THE TELESCOPE A QUARTER INCH TO THE RIGHT --
CARINA STEPS BACK AS MR. SWIFT COMES OUT FROM THE BACK --

text: What do you think you’re doing? That telescope was made by --
Sir Frederick Herschel. I know. THE GUN IS SHAKING IN SWIFT’S HAND -- HIS FACE FULL OF RA
No woman has ever touched my Herschel.
With apologies, Sir. Your celestial fix is slightly off. I moved it two degrees North.
You -- you -- what!?
Which means that map you've almost completed -- I’m afraid you'll have to start over.

head_text.subj: SWIFT GLANCES BACK AT HIS MAP

text: WHILE HE’S DISTRACTED CARINA QUICKLY RUSHES PAST HIM INTO
Start over... EXT. - SWIFT’S. - CONTINUOUS

head_text.subj: CARINA RUSHES INTO THE STREET, WHERE SEVERAL BRITISH SOLD
HER, PLACES A GUN AT HER HEAD.

text: Carina Smyth -- you will never again cast black magic toward the sky.
Black magic? You must be mistaken, Sir. I sew uniforms for the haberdasher each day --

head_text.subj: THE SEXTANT DROPS FROM HER DRESS

text: I will see you die, witch. Put her in the wagon!
Sir, please, let me explain! THE MEN GRAB CARINA -- DRAG HER OFF TO THE WAGON.  18. EXT. - BARBOSSA’S SHIP (QUEEN ANNE’S REVENGE). - DAY

head_text.subj: THE QUEEN ANNE IS OVERFLOWING WITH SPOILS

text: BARBOSSA’S MEN HAVE DOCKED IN ST. JAMES -- THE PIRATES

head_text.subj: TWO PIRATES FIGHT OVER A PAIR OF CANDLE STICKS --
ANOTHER PIRATE IS URINATING IN A CHINESE VASE --
THE MEN ARE EATING LIKE KINGS AND DRINKING FROM BARRELS -

text: THE EXACT OPPOSITE OF JACK’S SHIP -- INT. — CAPTAIN’S QUARTERS. - QUEEN ANNE’S. -— CONTINUOUS

head_text.subj: BARBOSSA SITS ALONE AT HIS DESK QUIETLY SETTLING ACCOUNTS
A STACK OF SILVER COINS IN FRONT OF HIM TO BE COUNTED.
HIS QUARTERS ARE FULL OF STOLEN GOODS FROM EVERY CORNER O
BARBOSSA OPENS A DRAWER TO FIND A FEATHERED PEN
A SMALL PORTRAIT OF A WOMAN. THE PAINTING IS CREASED AND

head_text.ToD: CLEARLY A GHOST FROM HIS PAST.

head_text.subj: HE LOOKS AT THE PORTRAIT FOR A BEAT
THE DRAWER AS HIS DOOR OPENS.

text: Sir, we know you said never to disturb you --
Or to come in without good cause --
Or to speak without first asking ourselves if our thoughts were absolutely necessary --
Like the ship being on fire -- you'd want to know that.

But it’s not on fire -- that being an example of a necessary thought. THE TWO MEN ARE SUDDENLY THROWN AGAINST THE WALL -—- PINN BACK FROM THE FORCE OF BLACKBEARD’S SWORD -- WHICH IS OUT POINTED AT THEM -—  19.

head_text.subj: STATE YOUR BUSINESS BEFORE I OPEN YOUR

text: We just come from town, Sir. The British are enraged -- rounding up pirates and witches as they wish. In no time they'll find their way to the Queen Anne.
It seems one of their ships went missing. The Monarch lost to the Triangle -- a full crew murdered at sea.
And how do they know this?
A survivor, Sir. One man lived to tell the tale. AND NOW BARBOSSA LOOKS AT THEM -- HIS WHEELS SPINNING.
Where is he? EXT. —- PORT ROYAL. - NIGHT

head_text.subj: THE SEEDY UNDERBELLY OF PORT ROYAL HAS COME ALIVE AT NIGH
WITH DERELICTS, WHORES AND DRUNKS ALL OVER THE BEACH. JAC
AND SCRUM MAKE THEIR WAY UNDER THE DOCKS, MOVE PAST A SER
OF SHACKS UNTIL THEY SEE ONE WITH A BLOOD RED DOOR.

text: The red door. Doesn’t look so bad, Scrum. You go first.
Jack, I don’t keep company with witches. All of them covered in warts and boils. Makes me miss my Mum.
Your mother was a witch?
Just incredibly ugly.
Nothing to be afraid of, Scrum. Except that two-headed dog.  20.

head_text.subj: A TWO-HEADED DOG IS GROWLING AT THEM BY THE RED DOOR --

text: I’m not going in there. Even the Redcoats are afraid to touch her. Let’s escape before it’s too late.

head_text.subj: SUDDENLY THE DOOR TO THE SHACK SLOWLY OPENS ON ITS OWN --

text: I believe it’s too late to be too late.

head_text.subj: AND JACK AND SCRUM STARE IN AT MELIA
NAKED WOMAN HIDING IN THE SHADOWS BY THE FIRELIGHT. HER L
HAIR COVERS HER BODY AS SHE POURS A CUP OF TEA FROM A KET

text: I've been expecting you, Jack Sparrow. Would you like some tea?

head_text.subj: SCRUM AND JACK STARE IN AT MELIA

text: I could go for a spot of tea. AND SCRUM LEADS THE WAY INSIDE. INT. - MELIA’S SHACK. - NIGHT

head_text.subj: SCRUM AND JACK MAKE THEIR WAY TOWARD MELIA
THE FIRE CASTING A GLOW ACROSS HER BEAUTIFUL FACE AND HID

text: I’ve brought you some gold.

head_text.subj: JACK HOLDS UP THE ONE GOLD COIN --
MELIA PULLS OUT A SHARP KNIFE AND SLOWLY MOVES TOWARD THE

text: On second thought -- I’1l pass on the tea.
Each time I cast a spell it cost me a piece of myself. This is the price I pay for stepping to the other side. The question is -- what price will you pay to be Captain of the Pearl again?
Name it and I shall pay it.  21. MELIA STEPS CLOSER -- TAKES THE KNIFE AND CUTS JACK’S FIN
Your blood. This is the price you agreed to pay when you came through my red door.
Might explain why you’re not very busy.
My powers are not strong enough. You’re the one who will free the Pearl.
Me?
It will be free when you find the Trident of Poseidon.
Hard to find something when you’re not looking for it.
But you are -- you just don’t know it yet. You will find The Map No Man Can Read -- which will lead you inside the Devil’s Triangle. This is where the Trident lies.
Jack -- did she say Devil’s --
Time to go!

head_text.subj: JACK AND SCRUM QUICKLY RUSHING TO LEAVE

text: You are wise to fear the Triangle. Captain Brand remains where you left him. Waiting 16 years to take the life that took his own. JACK TURNS TO HER NOW -- MORE THAN A BIT CONCERNED.  22.
Has it been 16 years? I’11 bet he’s forgotten all about me -- MELIA’S POT BOILING OVER NOW -- AND IN THE SEETHING WATER

This is a battle from your past. You sank his ship -- left him to sink beneath the gates of hell -- imprisoned in the triangle. And like all who die there, his spirit will not rest until he has his revenge.
He'll have to wait a bit longer -- as I have no plans to visit.
You have no choice. If you want to live.

head_text.subj: IN HER POT WE SUDDENLY SEE THE EYE

text: The dead Captain holds The Eye of Poseidon -- the key to finding the Trident. And with the Trident -- he will finally be free.
Free? Metaphorically?
Free to take his revenge on you. Your only hope is to find the Trident before he does.
So let me get this straight. You're saying the only way for me to live, is to sail into the one place on earth I am sure to die?
The Devil’s Triangle is your destiny.
Sorry -- don’t believe in destiny. Gets in the way of opportunity.
There is no escaping it. Tonight you will be married, have two children, and kill 46 men in cold blood.
Going to be a busy night.
You came here to save a ship, to save your name. But your only hope is to save your life.
And if I refuse to chase the ghosts of my past? OVER -- DRAWS JACK’S SWORD FROM HIS BELT.
Then Brand will use this sword to cut your throat. THE DOOR OPENS BEHIND THEM NOW.
Your destiny is sealed, Jack Sparrow. Find the Trident or die. EXT. —- PORT ROYAL. - NIGHT JACK AND SCRUM RUSH OUT OF MELIA’S SHACK -- BOTH A BIT RATTLED AS THEY LOOK UP AT THE MOON.
We never should have gone there, Jack. We have to find The Map No Man Can Read, which you're already looking for -- but just don’t know it.
If I can’t read it, then why would I look for it?
But that naked witch says your throat will be cut by your own sword. Did I mention she was naked?
Problem solved.  24.

head_text.subj: BRITISH SOLDIERS ARE SEARCHING FOR SOMEONE INSIDE THE PUB
ROUSING DRUNKS AND DERELICTS. JACK AND SCRUM WALK INTO TH

text: You see, Scrum. My only destiny is a bottle of rum and a warm bed upstairs. That witch was a charlatan, a two bit four-flusher...
Jack -- is that your sword?

head_text.subj: A FISHERMAN HAS CUT OPEN HIS NET AND DROPPED HIS CATCH ON

text: THAT JACK’S SWORD HAS DROPPED ONTO THE BAR.
No. Must be a fish. A swordfish.

head_text.subj: THE LARGEST OF THE FISH FLIPS ITS TAIL AND KNOCKS THE SWO

text: ONTO THE FLOOR -- WHERE IT’S QUICKLY KICKED ACROSS THE DI
EVENTUALLY LANDING RIGHT AT JACK’'S FEET.

head_text.subj: JACK SLOWLY BENDS DOWN TO PICK IT UP

text: That appears to be a double-edged bone and steel cutlass with a slight nick at the tip.
No. There is no destiny!

head_text.subj: JACK QUICKLY OPENS A BARREL OF RUM
AND THEN HEADS FOR THE DOOR --

text: JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) We'll try a different pub!

head_text.subj: AS HE TURNS TO LEAVE JACK WALKS STRAIGHT INTO A GUN

text: Well, if it isn’t the pirate who stole my ship! Jack looks at PIERRE “PIG” KELLY AND HIS FOUR LARGE MEN - ALL HOLDING WEAPONS.
Pig -- I’ve been looking for you. Wanted to give you this gold coin as compensation for borrowing the Gull.  25. JACK HOLDS UP THE GOLD COIN -- WHICH PIG TAKES.
You've been sailing on my ship.
You have three. And this one’s not much of a ship. One gun, leaks in the hull, rats everywhere.
Which are delicious by the way.
You’1ll settle your debt here and now.
Of course, Pig. Name your price.

Her name is Beatrice. And she’s my daughter. BEATRICE WALKS UP TO THEM NOW -- STARES AT JACK. PIG KELLY (CONT’D) She's a midwife -- no respectable man will have her. You'll do just fine. KELLY AND HIS MEN START TO LAUGH.
I‘1l do what?
Marry her. Take her off my hands forever. To clear your debt.
The honeymoon suite is waiting upstairs.
Remind me of the other option?
A bullet in your eye.
Scrum, go find me an eye patch.
Last chance.  26.
As a Captain I will officiate the ceremony. How’s next Tuesday?
Say “I do” or die.
I’m trying. Having a bit of a midwife crisis.

head_text.subj: SUDDENLY TWO HORRIBLE CHILDREN COME RUSHING UP TO JACK --

text: Jack, you remember the witch said you'd be married with kids?!
I do.
Congratulations!

head_text.subj: AND NOW TEN BRITISH SOLDIERS COME BURSTING INTO THE PUB -
SURROUND JACK AND PLACE HIM UNDER ARREST.

text: Jack Sparrow, in the name of the King you are under arrest. You killed 46 men in cold blood aboard the H.M.S. Monarch. JACK STARES AT THE WIFE -- THE KIDS -- THE SOLDIERS. EVERYTHING THE WITCH SAID HAS COME TRUE.
Jack -- can you find out if she has a sister?

head_text.subj: A HOSPITAL/INSANE ASYLUM IS FULL OF SOLDIERS BACK FROM TH
AN INJURED HENRY MADDOX LIES IN A HOSPITAL BED STARING OU

text: THE WINDOW. HE’S LOOKING OUT TO SEA -- HIS EYES BLANK -- HORROR OF HIS ORDEAL STILL ETCHED ACROSS HIS FACE.

head_text.subj: A DOCTOR IS TAKING HIS PULSE
SUDDENLY THE FINGER IS REPLACED BY A SWORD --
CREW. THEY ARE IN FULL PIRATE ACCOUTERMENT
DOCTORS ARE BACKING AWAY IN FEAR.

text: It be said one lucky man survived the massacre of the Monarch. A Captain's servant now without his senses found alive at sea -- who tells of murderous ghosts filling the oceans with blood. BARBOSSA LEANS IN NOW -- KEEPS HIS SWORD AT HENRY’S THROA
I’ve come to hear the tale.
Nobody believes in ghost stories.
Try me.
There was a diamond on a French ship -- a yellow diamond found by witches --
A diamond in the shape of an eye? Some say it be the key to unlocking the Trident. As the legend goes.
They took it aboard the Monarch -- and we were attacked by men -- dead men led by a Captain Brand. THE NAME CLEARLY REGISTERS WITH BARBOSSA. HENRY MADDOX (CONT’D) Will you take me back there, Sir?
You wish to return?
I left someone alive. Her name is Olivia -- and I made a promise to find her -- to save her. And that is what I will do.
Sorry, boy. I don’t sail with Redcoats. BARBOSSA TURNS TO LEAVE -—  28.
The Eye will be his forever. There is no one to challenge a murderous ghost with a taste for blood.
Blood is common currency. Maybe he desires something far more valuable.
What would that be?
The one thing all dead men seek. Revenge.

head_text.subj: JACK IS BEING HELD DOWN BY TWO BRITISH SOLDIERS AS HE GET

text: We believe the massacre of the Monarch was the work of pirates. You don’t kill my men without paying a heavy debt.
How about I marry your daughter?

head_text.subj: AND NOW SCARFIELD HITS HIM HARD ACROSS THE JAW --

text: A pirate is responsible for butchering those men. Which means a pirate shall die for it.
Have you considered the work of William Kidd? I hear his ship has over 100 guns -- seems to be having a very good year.
William Kidd does not sail in these waters. But you do --
What about Red Beard? He’s very tough -- and that beard -- it’s very red. You'd get a nice crowd to see him die.
You pirates think you can challenge us? We’re the British Navy -- and we control the seas.  29.

head_text.subj: JACK LOOKS UP AT HIM NOW --

text: No one can control her. The ocean is as free as a pirate -- always will be.
But you’re not free. You’re guilty of murder and will face a public execution. How would you like to die? Hanging, firing squad, or a new invention -- the guillotine.
Guillotine. Sounds French. I love the French. How bad can it be?

head_text.subj: THE BRITISH COMMAND IN PORT ROYAL HAS FILLED THEIR JAIL W
JACK IS TAKEN DOWN TO THE JAIL BY TWO GUARDS. AS HE PASSE
BY ONE OF THE CELLS HE CASUALLY SAYS HELLO TO HIS FATHER
WHO IS ALSO WAITING TO BE EXECUTED.

text: How are ya, Dad?
Never better, Jackie. What are you in for?
Destiny. You?
Lechery. By the way, if you're getting disemboweled ask for Victor.
Excellent tip. What do you know of the Eye of Poseidon?
Witches found it. That’s why they’ve arrested them all -- they want the diamond back.
If they’re searching for The Eye -- they're going after the Trident as well. THE BRITISH GRAB JACK -- TRY TO PULL HIM AWAY.  30.
Every nation at war is searching for the Trident, Jackie. But it can never be found -- as it rests in Poseidon’s watery grave.
The Tomb of Posedion?
A tomb never to be disturbed, Jackie. For no man should hold the sea in his hands.

head_text.subj: THE BRITISH PULL JACK DOWN THE HALL, AND JACK YELLS BACK

text: Dad -- how did you choose to die?
Guillotine. Sounds French. And I love the French.

head_text.subj: JACK IS THROWN INTO CELL NEAR THE FRONT OF THE PRISON --
BUNCH OF CUTTHROATS STARING AT HIM.

text: INT. — JACK'S SHIP (THE DYING GULL). - DAY SCRUM IS FACING GIBBS AND THE REST OF JACK’S CREW -- WHO SEEM CONFUSED AS THEY STAND ON THE MAIN DECK.
Doesn’t make no sense, Scrum. Why would Jack get married and not invite any of us?
Maybe he’s ashamed of us.
You're not following --
And why would he kill 46 men in cold blood?
On his wedding day no less.
The point is -- Jack’s been arrested.
Since we did not attend the wedding -- are we obliged to make an offering of gifts?  31.
He’s about to be killed straight away! We have to do something.
And why would we do that? Seems to me he’s lied to us, fleeced and swindled us at every turn.
And when we was going straight.
Are you forgetting the diamonds! Knowing Jack he’s probably got his hands on that treasure right now!
There is no treasure. Just another lie from Captain Sparrow.
Aye. But a lie from Jack Sparrow always leads to another lie -- a bigger lie -- a lie that on occasion leads to a grain of truth.

head_text.subj: THE MEN LOOK AT GIBBS NOW --

text: So if you be wanting your share of this lie -- you’ll have to save him!

head_text.subj: FROM INSIDE HIS CELL, JACK LOOKS AT THE WITCHES DIRECTLY
ACROSS FROM HIM. THEY ARE CRAMMED INTO THEIR CELL
CHARMLESS AND UNRULY BUNCH OF HAGS
CARINA SMYTH IS FURIOUSLY WRITING ON THE WALLS

text: So what's these markings on the wall then?
Casting spells no doubt. She’s going to free us all from the hangman's noose!
I’m no witch.  32. THEY ALL LAUGH AT HER -——
Tell us then -- what is it you’re scribbling there? What are all those numbers?
It’s an equation from Galileo’s diary. I believe it’s part of a map.
What kind of map?
You wouldn’t understand. It’s a Map --
-- No Man Can Read. AND NOW CARINA WALKS TO THE BARS --— AND JACK GETS TO HIS

head_text.subj: -- KNOWS HIS DESTINY IS STANDING DIRECTLY ACROSS FROM HIM

text: THAT SHE ALONE CAN LEAD HIM WHERE HE NEEDS TO GO. MTHERE’ JUST ONE SMALL PROBLEM.
Open the cells. It’s time to die.

head_text.subj: THE TOWN SQUARE IS FILLED WITH PRISONERS WAITING TO BE
KILLED. A CROWD OF LOCALS IS CHEERING, SCREAMING, ENJOYIN
A TERRIFIED PIRATE LOCKED INSIDE THE GUILLOTINE,
PRAYING TO HIMSELF. THE EXECUTIONER PULLS THE SWITCH, AND

text: THE BLADE COMES DOWN HARD -- THE MAN’S HEAD ROLLING INTO

head_text.subj: BASKET. JACK STANDS NEXT TO THE GUILLOTINE WATCHING THIS
WITH A LOOK OF SHEER REPULSION ON HIS FACE.

text: So that’s a guillotine? THEY DRAG JACK UP TO THE GUILLOTINE -- OPEN THE LOCKS --—
I've changed my mind. Like to go with firing squad. Is there someone I could talk to...
Silence!  33.
The French are obviously sick people. How about a good old-fashioned stoning -- gets the crowd involved.

head_text.subj: THEY SHOVE JACK INTO THE GUILLOTINE AND TRY TO LOCK HIM I

text: JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) There’s quite a bit of blood on there. And a good portion of neck.

head_text.subj: ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE SQUARE CARINA SMYTH IS STANDING

text: These will be the last words of Carina Smyth. OUT A PIECE OF PAPER AND BEGINS TO READ. CARINA SMYTH (CONT’D) Good Sirs -- I am not a witch and have never practiced witchcraft. But I forgive your common dim-wittedness and feeble brains incapable of educated thought. In short, most of you have the mind of a goat -- Jack yells out from the guillotine.
If I could request a word. Is it not common practice for those being executed to be offered a last meal?
Sir, I believe I was making a point. If you could just be patient.
My head is about to be lopped off -- hence the urgency.
And my neck is to be broken.
On occasion the neck doesn’t break.
What?
I’ve seen men swing for hours -- the life slowly choking out of them. Eyes bulging, tongue swelling -- not pretty.  34.
May I finish!

The point is -- it’s entirely possible you still have hours left to whisper your last words, whereas my head will soon be in this basket staring up at my lifeless body -- which happens to be famished!
Go ahead and kill him. I’11 wait.
I wouldn’t hear of it. Witches first.

head_text.subj: HARD TO LISTEN WITH THE MIND OF A

text: CARINA’S HANDS ARE TIED BEHIND HER BACK -- AND JACK WATCH AS THE EXECUTIONER STEPS FORWARD.

head_text.subj: WE NOW PUT TO DEATH THE PIRATE JACK

text: SPARROW -—

head_text.subj: NOT A WITCH. NEVER BEEN A WITCH.
ON THIS DAY BEFORE THE GOOD PEOPLE OF
AT THE GUILLOTINE THE EXECUTIONER HITS THE SWITCH

text: BUT AS THE BLADE DROPS AN EXPLOSION ROCKS THE TOWN -—

head_text.subj: THE TOP HALF OF THE GUILLOTINE HAS BEEN BLOWN OFF

text: A CANNON HAS BEEN DRAGGED TO THE MIDDLE OF TOWN BY JACK’S
SCRUM AND GIBBS QUICKLY RELOADING AS THE REST OF JACK’S C

head_text.subj: THE BRITISH HAVE BEEN CAUGHT OFF GUARD
THE CROWD TAKING COVER AS THE PIRATES ATTACK --
CARINA WATCHING THE CHAOS FROM THE GALLOWS
A PIRATE FIGHTING A BRITISH SOLDIER RIGHT IN FRONT OF HER
-- AS A THIRD CANNON BALL HITS THE WALL OF A BUILDING --

text: SOLDIERS CRUSHED BY FALLING STONES --—
THE HANDFUL OF BRITISH START TO RETREAT -- TAKE COVER --—

head_text.subj: AS THE BRITISH SOLDIER IS KNOCKED COLD RIGHT IN FRONT OF

text: INCHES --—

head_text.subj: UNTIL HIS HAND LANDS RIGHT ON TOP OF IT --
AND THE FLOOR OPENS UNDER HER
DOWN AS SHE BEGINS TO HANG
JACK RUSHING TOWARD SCRUM AND GIBBS --

text: THERE’S NO MORE CANNONBALLS!  36.

head_text.subj: AND JACK GRABS THE LAST PRISONER'S HEAD FROM THE BASKET -

text: ROPE SNAPPING AND CARINA DROPPING HARD TO THE GROUND -— SLAMMING HER HEAD AS SHE’S KNOCKED COLD.

head_text.subj: SOLDIERS COMING DOWN FROM THE MAIN FORT
HIGH ON A HILL ABOVE THE TO

text: JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) Collect the girl, Mr. Gibbs. It’s time to leave Port Royal.

head_text.subj: JACK, SCRUM AND GIBBS RUSH WITH THE REST OF THE CREW TO B

text: SHIP -—-
Shove off, boys!
Un-lash the boot and bring the draw --
You think I’m letting you take my ship? Again?

head_text.subj: JACK TURNS TO SEE PIG KELLY STANDING BEHIND HIM ON DECK -

text: GUN DRAWN AND AIMED AT JACK’'S FOREHEAD.
Well, Pig, it would appear you have no choice.
How do you figure? A GUN IS NOW PLACED AT KELLY’S HEAD. THE WEAPON COCKED --
Step away from me husband.

head_text.subj: BEATRICE HAS HER OWN GUN OUT

text: SPITS -- AND HER FATHER CAN HARDLY BELIEVE WHAT’S HAPPENI  37.
This loathsome pirate is trying to steal my ship.
He’s already stolen me heart. JACK TAKES THE GUN FROM KELLY’S HAND AS SEVERAL PIRATES G HIM FROM BEHIND.
Thank you, darling. But I really must go now. My best to the children. JACK AT THE WHEEL -— JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) Draw the main! We’re shoving off to race the gallows!

head_text.subj: AS THE DYING GULL HEADS OUT TO SEA

text: STAND ON THE DOCK WATCHING THEM GO --—
PIG KELLY’S OWN MEN APPROACH WITH GUNS DRAWN -- OPEN FIRE
AS PIG MOTIONS TO ANOTHER SHIP IN THE HARBOR --—
Ready the Essex! We’ll chase her down before the sun sets. EXT. - JACK’S SHIP. - DAY

head_text.subj: JACK SMILES AS HE LOOKS OUT AT THE HORIZON

text: SEA AGAIN. SCRUM NEXT TO HIM -—
The crew won’t stand for a woman, Jack.
She will lead me to the Trident.
But a woman on board brings nothing but bad luck. And rabies.
Frivolous superstition, Mr. Scrum. As you can see, luck is steadfast on my side.  38. ONE OF THE CREW MEMBERS APPROACHES JACK WITH A SWORD.

Good news, Captain. I found this in town this morning. It was inside an empty barrel of rum -- THE CREW MEMBER HOLDS UP THE SWORD -- HANDS IT TO JACK. PIRATE #1 (CONT’D) I believe it’s yours. A double-edged bone and steel cutlass --
YES! I can see it’s mine!

head_text.subj: JACK LOOKS TERRIFIED AS HE SLOWLY REACHES OUT TO GRAB HIS

text: It’s been a pleasure knowing you.

head_text.subj: AND JACK TOSSES THE SWORD INTO THE SEA --

text: INT. - BARBOSSA’S SHIP. - DAY Barbossa is at the wheel of THE QUEEN ANNE’S REVENGE -- eyeing the sea as he holds BLACKBEARD’S SWORD. PINTEL AND RAGETTI APPROACH HIM -- BOTH A BIT HESITANT.
Sir, not that it’s our place to ask questions --
Or to question the answer that you may give to such a question --
Which by right -- you need not answer -—
But the men be asking to which port we sail? Seeing as that British soldier mentioned the name of a Captain Brand.
A Captain as dead as any man who dwells at the bottom of the sea.
And his crew -- very dead men one and all. As the tale is told.  39.
Tell the men we're searching for the Trident of Poseidon. A treasure so powerful it puts all others to shame.
But our ship is full of treasure, Sir.

Imagine all the warring nations having to bid for their own survival. A King’s ransom the likes of which no pirate has ever seen! This be the power of the Trident -- the last treasure any man need hold. Pintel and Ragetti look confused now.
Last treasure?
Now be the time to find a tranquil island -- a place to put my leg up. The Trident will be the last treasure these hands possess.
And this Captain Brand? What should we tell the crew?
Tell them we’re about to tap on his door -- see if he’s home.

head_text.subj: AND NOW WE SEE THE OUTLINE OF THE TRIANGLE IN THE DISTANC
THE THREE BORDER ISLANDS FORMING A VISION OF NAUTICAL HOR

text: Gentlemen -- welcome to The Devil's Triangle!

head_text.subj: TWO LARGE ROCK FORMATIONS SERVE AS THE ENTRANCE
BARBOSSA IS SAILING STRAIGHT FOR THEM
AND NOW BARBOSSA CALMLY SAILS HIS SHIP STRAIGHT TOWARD TH

text: DEVIL’S TRIANGLE -- USES HIS SWORD TO CONTROL THE WIND IN

head_text.subj: THE CREW STARING OUT AT THE TRIANGLE IN THE DISTANCE
OF THEM IMMEDIATELY AWARE OF THEIR FATE.

text: EXT. -— JACK’S SHIP. - DAY

head_text.subj: JACK TAKES A BUCKET OF WATER

text: Carina coughing up water -- soaking wet and furious as sh gets to her feet -- looks around at Jack -- the ship -- t crew. ALL THE MEN STARING AT HER NOW. SHE BACKS AWAY FROM
How did I get here? Where are you taking me?
Is that the thanks I get for saving your neck?
You're that pirate -- Jack Sparrow.
Captain Jack Sparrow.
What do you want with me? Where is my diary? JACK HOLDS UP HER DIARY.
It’s just a bunch of numbers. I'’11 be needing that map. The Map No Man Can Read.
If you could read it -- then it wouldn’t be called The Map No Man Can Read.
She's got a point there, Jack.
Most of the men on this ship can’t read -- so that makes all maps The Map No Man Can Read.
If no one can read it -- then you have no use for it or me.
Hard to argue there, Jack.
I need to free a ship from a bottle. And you have a map --
Nobody has this map -- as it does not exist --  41.
Then why does it have a name?
The name clearly defines it as an imperceptible object.
I was about to say that.
Then we all agree there is no map?
Settled!
You're confusing these poor men! Which is what witches do best!

head_text.subj: AND NOW THERE IS DEAD SILENCE

text: Did he say “witches”?
Jack, tell us you didn’t bring a witch on a ship?
Of course not. Look at her luminous yellow hair. Those round and bountiful -- eyes. Does she resemble any witch you've seen?
I am not a witch.
You see. Not a witch.
I’m an astronomer.
Oh, so you make hats?
An astronomer contemplates the stars. The planets. This is what I was doing when they arrested me. I had mapped the solar system. A LONG BEAT AS THEY ALL STARE AT HER --—  42.
Jack steps in front of her now -- draws his sword and put at her throat.
Allow me to simplify this equation. Give me that map or I'll let them kill you.
If they kill me you’1ll never get the map.
Excellent bit of reasoning there, Jack.
You can kidnap me, imprison me, kill me if you wish. But I’1ll never give you what you want! And now Jack puts the sword away.
What I want is a cup of tea. Care to join me?
Carina is staring at her own hand -- can barely keep her open. SHE IS CLEARLY DRUNK -- trying desperately to focus
What kind of tea did you say it was?
Pirate’s tea. Family recipe. JACK STANDS BEHIND HER SPIKING HER TEA WITH RUM.
It has a funny taste. I can’t quite figure it out --
Unlike The Map No Man Can Read? Which you have solved. SHE SMILES NOW -- DRINKS SOME MORE --—  43.
Can you keep a secret, Captain Jack?
Why steal secrets if you’re not going to keep them?
There’s a reason the Map has never been read by any man. Or woman. She leans in close now -- whispers to him. CARINA SMYTH (CONT’D) The Map is written in the stars.
Someone must have an enormous quill.

head_text.subj: SHE TAKES OUT A SMALL BLACK BOOK --

text: Galileo's diary dates back to the first astronomer -- Plato himself. The diary is full of celestial binomials -- equations passed down through the centuries from scholar to scholar -- the last being my father. None of them could figure it out.
But you have?
Once every 243 years the planet Venus crosses directly in front of Orion’s Belt -- known as the Three Fingers of God. This event is known as The Transit of Venus.
I'll drink to that.
This is the answer to the equation. With a clear sky the stars themselves will map the Devil’s Triangle.
A map that will lead you to the Tomb of Poseidon. And the Trident inside.
How could you know about the Trident?
You're not the only witch in town.
After tonight -- I’1l never be called a witch again!
Tonight?
As the sun sets -- my destiny begins! AND NOW CARINA PASSES OUT -- SHE’S FACE DOWN ON THE TABLE
I hate destiny. EXT. -— DEVIL’S TRIANGLE. - DAY BARBOSSA HAS BLACKBEARD’S SWORD IN HAND -- HAS DELIBERATE

head_text.subj: SAILED HIS SHIP INTO THE HEAVY FOG. AND NOW THE WAITING

text: THE FOG AND CLOUDS CAST A DARK SHADOW ACROSS THE SHIP --— A FEW CREW MEMBERS SNEAK DOWN BELOW TO HIDE --—
AS BARBOSSA STANDS BACK NEAR THE WHEEL -——

head_text.subj: PINTEL AND RAGETTI ACCIDENTLY BUMP INTO EACH OTHER
THE SHIP HAS BECOME A HAUNTED HOUSE

text: EVERY CREAK UNDER THEIR FEET -- BUT THERE’S NO SIGN OF ANYTHING. UNTIL -—-
Captain, is that a ship?
Shipwreck.
BARBOSSA’S CREW AT THE FRONT OF THE SHIP ARE QUICKLY KILL

head_text.subj: CAPTAIN BRAND AND HIS VERY DEAD MEN HAVE COME ABOARD. SOM

text: OF BARBOSSA’S MEN RUNNING FOR THEIR LIVES -- DIVING OFF T SHIP -—-
AND EVERYTHING -——
Pirates. Kill them all.  45.

head_text.subj: CAPTAIN BRAND STEPS TOWARD BARBOSSA NOW
ALL LOOKING AS IF THEY'VE WALKED OUT OF HELL ITSELF.
BRAND STOPS JUST BEFORE HE REACHES BARBOSSA
LEFT AND SEES THE ROCK FORMATIONS

text: CAPTAIN BRAND (CONT’D) You've kept half of your ship outside the triangle. Very clever.

head_text.subj: MEN ARE SCREAMING IN THE B.G. --

text: Although it doesn’t help the men on this side of the line.
I always bring extra crew just in case. Welcome aboard The Revenge, Captain Brand.
You know my name.
Aye. And I’ve come for a confluence. BRAND AND HIS MEN LAUGH AT THIS.
Did you hear that, men? This pirate has come searching for us. All you have is your life to bargain with.
I come with a tale.
And what would this tale be about?
There was a British Captain. A Captain who had in his command his own brother -- a brother by the name Eric. The two men never far apart.

head_text.subj: WE SEE YOUNG CAPTAIN JOHN BRAND AND HIS BROTHER ERIC FIGH
SIDE BY SIDE ON A BRITISH WAR SHIP

text: A SPANISH GALLEON --—  46.

head_text.subj: SUDDENLY THEIR SHIP GETS ROCKED BY CANNON FIRE

text: EXPLOSION BLOWING ERIC OVERBOARD --—
While engaged in battle with the Spanish, Eric was lost to the sea -- sinking beneath the waves.

head_text.subj: WE SEE CAPTAIN BRAND REACHING FOR HIS BROTHER
SMOKE CAPTAIN BRAND SEES ERIC DROWNING IN THE DEEP WATER

text: And so this Captain’s heart was broken -- knowing he would never see his brother again. EXT. —- OPEN OCEAN. - DAY (FLASHBACK) A PIRATE SHIP sails into frame -- THE PIRATES FISHING A M
But as fate would have it a pirate ship found the half-dead soldier -- dragged Eric from certain death and put him in chains. WE SEE ERIC ON THE PIRATE SHIP IN CHAINS -——
At first they thought to hold him for ransom, but then the Captain of this pirate ship saw something in him.

head_text.subj: WE SEE ERIC TRYING TO STEAL AN APPLE FROM THE SHIP
ABOUT TO EAT IT WHEN HE IS SUDDENLY CAUGHT BY SURPRISE --

text: And this Captain decided to train him in the ways of the pirate. Taught him everything he knew -- how to steal and plunder -- how to enjoin a group of knaves who refuse all orders.

head_text.subj: ERIC NO LONGER LOOKS LIKE A SOLDIER. HE RESEMBLES A PIRAT

text: He was taught every vile trick this Captain knew, until Eric was ready to take on a ship of his own. Only now he would be a pirate Captain -- with a pirate name stealing his own fortune at sea.  47. WE SEE ERIC at the wheel of his own Pirate ship -- lookin the horizon --
And so it was. Until one day when the pirate Eric was attacked in full force by the British Navy. EXPLOSIONS ROCKING ERIC’S SHIP -- MEN DEAD ALL AROUND --
Strike the colors! Lower the flag!!
He tried to surrender -- but the Captain of the British ship had a loathing for all pirates. He kept firing until he burned the pirate Eric right out of the water.

head_text.subj: AND NOW WE SEE CAPTAIN BRAND ON THE DECK OF HIS OWN BRITI

text: You see -- this Captain had no idea he was killing his own brother. Murdering the only thing he loved.

head_text.subj: CAPTAIN BRAND WATCHING THE PIRATE SHIP SINK --

text: SEEING THE FACE OF HIS BROTHER staring across at him --
And upon the realization of what he had done, this Captain soon went into a rage. And he vowed revenge on one man. Captain Jack Sparrow. The man who turned your brother into a pirate.

head_text.subj: WE SEE CAPTAIN BRAND RAISE HIS SWORD

text: THE BLACK PEARL --—

And so he chased Jack into the waters of the Devil’s Triangle -- where Jack waited for him in a devilish fog -- springing a trap that would send him to the bottom of the sea. WE SEE THE BLACK PEARL BLOWING BRAND’S SHIP OUT OF THE WA

head_text.subj: OWN THROAT AS HE GOES DOWN.

text: And as the Captain sank to the gates of hell -- a spirit with unfinished business rose in his place.
You were on the Pearl?
Aye. I saw you die. And soon after I planned a mutiny against Jack Sparrow and took the ship as my own.
So my enemy is your enemy?
More than you could ever know.

head_text.subj: CAPTAIN JACK SPARROW WILL PAY HIS DEBT

text: The Eye.

head_text.subj: BRAND TAKES OUT THE DIAMOND EYE

text: Bring him to me -- and I will give you The Eye. From this moment on -- you have a deal with the dead.
You'll pardon me for not shaking on it.

head_text.subj: CARINA IS PASSED OUT ON DECK
TRIES TO WAKE HER UP. MOST OF THE CREW NERVOUSLY WATCHING
FROM A DISTANCE. JACK GLANCES AT THE SETTING SUN --

text: Mr. Scrum -- wake her up.

So that was a mutiny. I must admit it was rather exciting. All those swords and guns. The larger men holding you down and beating you when you refused to leave. The smaller men lining up to slap you --
You just cost me the command of two ships.

One was in a bottle. Long story.

On that we both agree.  54.
In case you have forgotten, the aforementioned kidnapping also included the saving of your neck --
You did not save me out of courtesy. You seek the Trident --
I have no choice. There’s a ghost who dwells in the haunted waters of the Triangle, a spirit plotting his escape.
A spirit?
I have to find the Trident before he does. CARINA STARING AT HIM -- CAN’T HELP BUT LAUGH --
Ghosts! That is what all of you pirates are afraid of? GHOSTS!!
Yes. Ghosts. And lizards. And Quakers.
I assure you, there are no ghosts in the Devil’s Triangle or anywhere else. Science does not support it.
And if you're wrong?

You think you’re the only one who knows anything about Venus? Venus was the Roman goddess of love and beauty.
And who taught you that?
A girl named Venus --
Was she academically inclined?  55.
More like vertically reclined.
My calculations are precise and true. I’m not just an astronomer -- I’m also a horologist.
No shame in that, dear. We all have to earn a living.
No. A Horologist!
Yes. So was Venus. Although she didn’t shout it quite as loud as you. I must say you seem very proud!
Horology is the study of time.
She was constantly studying her watch.
Time is everything, Captain Sparrow.
I prefer timing. CARINA HOLDS UP THE WATCH AROUND HER NECK.
This Chronometer keeps the exact time in London. If I make an altitude measurement to a known heavenly body such as the sun -- we will find land. LIGHT REFLECTS OFF THE CHRONOMETER -- BLINDING JACK.

text: JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) Something wrong with your map?

JACK SPARROW (CONT’D) Where did you get that earring?
A gift from my father -- a father I never knew.
A clover is bad luck at sea. He wasn’t a sailor.
He was a scientist. The earring was left to me after he died -- along with a love of the stars. The most beautiful thing there is.
Nothing compares with the beauty of the sea.
Don’t you ever look up?
Only when I’m flat on my back. You take your stars, and I'll take my horizon.

They are forever connected. A map maker’s sextant calculates the angle between a star and the horizon. So even if they are worlds apart, they are forever entwined -- the stars and the horizon existing as lovers.

Eric the Pirate.

Henry Maddox. I made my way to Coronation Bay to secure passage back to the Triangle.
Back?

I will present it to the King -- hand him his greatest treasure. And from that day forward my name will be pronounced with high regard. And I’1l never be called a witch again.

Maybe this will help. AND NOW JACK HANDS HER “THE EYE” -- THE YELLOW DIAMOND SPARKLING IN HER HAND.
What kind of pirate gives up his treasure? 119.

head_text.subj: AND NOW HE OPENS HIS OTHER HAND

text: Who said I’ve given anything up?
I'll keep this diamond with the hopes that one day you’1ll do the right thing.
And what might that be?
You're a pirate. Steal it back. CARINA GETS INTO THE COACH -- AND THE HORSES TAKE OFF. WATCHES FOR A BEAT --—

head_text.subj: CARINA SITS IN THE COACH WITH SOME VERY WELL DRESSED,
DIGNIFIED LOOKING MEN. SHE TAKES OUT A LEATHER FLASK

text: A LONG STIFF DRINK -- OFFERS THEM THE FLASK -——
Pirate’s tea, anyone? THE MEN LOOK HORRIFIED AS SHE SITS BACK AND SMILES -——

head_text.subj: OUT THE WINDOW OF THE COACH --
HER CLOVER EARRING DANGLING IN THE SUN.

text: EXT. —- BLACK PEARL. - DAY

head_text.subj: THE SHIP IS STILL DOCKED AS JACK STEPS ON BOARD

text: As promised, give these diamonds to the crew, Scrum.
Aye, Sir.

Good news, Captain. One of the men found this washed ashore in the harbor. How’s that for luck? GIBBS IS HOLDING JACK’S SWORD. JACK HESITATES FOR A LONG BEAT -- THEN TAKES HIS SWORD AND PUTS IT IN HIS BELT -—
So where we headed, Jack?
We'll be following the stars, Mr. Gibbs. Wherever they may take us.
It’s good to have the Black Pearl back, is it not, Captain?
I’ve been thinking, Gibbs. Perhaps this ship could use a new name. A name to strike fear into our enemies -- and bring us more treasure than we could imagine.
And what name did you have in mind, Sir?

head_text.subj: AS THE SHIP SAILS FROM THE HARBOR AND HEADS OUT TO SEA --
CAPTAIN JACK SPARROW IS AT THE WHEEL OF THE BARBOSSA --
SAILING TOWARD A PERFECT RED SUNSET. HE HAS HIS SHIP
AS HE SAILS OFF TOWARD THE HORIZON
